alerts_enabled.description: choose 1 to enable alerts, or 0 to disable alerts. Defaults to 1

api_links.description: self links to endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to endpoint for test data

bgp_measurements.description: choose 1 to enable bgp measurements, 0 to disable; defaults to 1

direction.description: [TO_TARGET, FROM_TARGET, BIDIRECTIONAL]	Direction of the test (affects how results are shown)

dscp_id.description: A Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) is a value found in an IP packet header which is used to request a level of priority for delivery (Defined in RFC 2474 https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2474.txt). It is one of the Quality of Service management tools used in router configuration to protect real-time and high priority data applications.

enabled.description: 0 or 1	choose 1 to enable the test, 0 to disable the test

interval.description: interval to run test on, in seconds

live_share.description: indicates 1 for a test shared with your account group, 0 for a normal test (does not apply to DNS+ tests)

modified_date.description: Last modified by date; shown in UTC

mtu_measurements.description: set to 1 to measure MTU sizes on network from agents to the target.

network_measurements.description: integer	0 or 1	choose 1 to enable network measurements, 0 to disable; defaults to 1

path_trace_mode.description: choose inSession to perform the path trace within a TCP session; defaults to classic

protocol.description: Protocol for agent to agent tests, TCP or UDP.  Defaults to TCP

saved_event.description: indicates 1 for a saved event, 0 for a normal test

target_agent_id.description: pull from /agents endpoint	Both the 'agents': [] and the targetAgentID cannot be cloud agents. Can be Enterprise Agent -> Cloud, Cloud -> Enterprise Agent, or Enterprise Agent -> Enterprise Agent

throughput_measurements.description: 0 or 1	defaults to 0 (disabled), not allowed when source (or target) of the test is a cloud agent

type.description: Type of test

use_public_bgp.description: set to 1 to automatically add all available Public BGP Monitors

default.description: to set the rule as a default, set this value to 1.

direction.description: [TO_TARGET, FROM_TARGET, BIDIRECTIONAL]	Direction of the test (affects how results are shown)

include_covered_prefixes.description: set to 1 to include queries for subprefixes detected under this prefix

minimum_sources.description: The minimum number of agents or monitors that must meet the specified criteria in order to trigger an alert

minimum_sources_pct.description: The minimum percentage of agents or monitors that must meet the specified criteria in order to trigger an alert

notify_on_clear.description: set to 1 to trigger the notification when the alert clears.

rounds_violating_mode.description: ANY or EXACT.  EXACT requires that the same agent(s) meet the threshold in consecutive rounds; default is ANY

rounds_violating_out_of.description: specifies the divisor (Y value) of the “X of Y times” condition in an alert rule.  Minimum value is 1, maximum value is 10.

rounds_violating_required.description: specifies the numerator (X value) of the “X of Y times” condition in an alert rule.  Minimum value is 1, maximum value is 10. Must be less than or equal to roundsViolatingOutOf

rule_id.description: If alertsEnabled is set to 1 and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, applicable defaults will be used.

block.description: List of notifications for the Alert Rule
get ruleId from /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 1 and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, applicable defaults will be used.

builtin.description: 1 for built-in labels, and 0 for user-created labels. Note that built-in labels are read-only

type.description: Type of label (tests, agents, endpoint_tests, or endpoint_agents

block.description: array of DNS Server objects {“serverName”: “fqdn of server”}

alerts_enabled.description: choose 1 to enable alerts, or 0 to disable alerts. Defaults to 1

api_links.description: self links to endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to endpoint for test data

bgp_measurements.description: choose 1 to enable bgp measurements, 0 to disable; defaults to 1

download_limit.description: specify maximum number of bytes to download from the target object

enabled.description: 0 or 1	choose 1 to enable the test, 0 to disable the test

ftp_target_time.description: target time for operation completion; specified in milliseconds

ftp_time_limit.description: Set the time limit for the test (in seconds). FTP tests default to 10s.

interval.description: interval to run test on, in seconds

live_share.description: indicates 1 for a test shared with your account group, 0 for a normal test (does not apply to DNS+ tests)

modified_date.description: Last modified by date; shown in UTC

mtu_measurements.description: set to 1 to measure MTU sizes on network from agents to the target.

network_measurements.description: integer	0 or 1	choose 1 to enable network measurements, 0 to disable; defaults to 1

password.description: password to be used to authenticate with the destination server (required for FTP)

path_trace_mode.description: choose inSession to perform the path trace within a TCP session; defaults to classic

probe_mode.description: probe mode used by End-to-end Network Test; only valid if protocol is set to TCP; defaults to AUTO

protocol.description: protocol used by dependent Network tests (End-to-end, Path Trace, PMTUD); defaults to TCP

request_type.description: Set the type of activity for the test: Download, Upload, or List

saved_event.description: indicates 1 for a saved event, 0 for a normal test

type.description: Type of test

use_active_ftp.description: explicitly set the flag to use active FTP. Tests are set to use passive FTP by default

use_explicit_ftps.description: use explicit FTPS (ftp over SSL). By default, tests will autodetect when it is appropriate to use FTPS.

username.description: username to be used to authenticate with the destination server

default.description: to set the rule as a default, set this value to 1.

direction.description: [TO_TARGET, FROM_TARGET, BIDIRECTIONAL]	Direction of the test (affects how results are shown)

rounds_violating_required.description: specifies the numerator (X value) of the “X of Y times” condition in an alert rule.  Minimum value is 1, maximum value is 10. Must be less than or equal to roundsViolatingOutOf

builtin.description: 1 for built-in labels, and 0 for user-created labels. Note that built-in labels are read-only

type.description: Type of label (tests, agents, endpoint_tests, or endpoint_agents

block.description: array of DNS Server objects {“serverName”: “fqdn of server”}

alerts_enabled.description: choose 1 to enable alerts, or 0 to disable alerts. Defaults to 1

api_links.description: self links to endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to endpoint for test data

bandwidth_measurements.description: set to 1 to measure bandwidth; defaults to 0. Only applies to Enterprise Agents assigned to the test, and requires that networkMeasurements is set.

bgp_measurements.description: choose 1 to enable bgp measurements, 0 to disable; defaults to 1

client_certificate.description: String representation (containing newline characters) of client certificate, if used

content_regex.description: regular Expressions	Verify content using a regular expression. This field does not require escaping

desired_status_code.description: A valid HTTP response code	Set to the value you’re interested in retrieving

dns_override.description: IP address to use for DNS override

download_limit.description: specify maximum number of bytes to download from the target object

enabled.description: 0 or 1	choose 1 to enable the test, 0 to disable the test

follow_redirects.description: set to 0 to not follow HTTP/301 or HTTP/302 redirect directives. Default is 1

headers.description: array of header strings ["header: value", "header2: value"]

http_target_time.description: target time for HTTP server completion; specified in milliseconds

http_time_limit.description: target time for HTTP server limits; specified in seconds

http_version.description: 2 for default (prefer HTTP/2), 1 for HTTP/1.1 only

interval.description: interval to run test on, in seconds

live_share.description: indicates 1 for a test shared with your account group, 0 for a normal test (does not apply to DNS+ tests)

modified_date.description: Last modified by date; shown in UTC

mtu_measurements.description: set to 1 to measure MTU sizes on network from agents to the target.

network_measurements.description: integer	0 or 1	choose 1 to enable network measurements, 0 to disable; defaults to 1

password.description: password to be used to authenticate with the destination server

path_trace_mode.description: choose inSession to perform the path trace within a TCP session; defaults to classic

post_body.description: Enter the post body in this field. No escaping is required. If the post body is set to something other than empty, the requestMethod will be set to POST.

probe_mode.description: probe mode used by End-to-end Network Test; only valid if protocol is set to TCP; defaults to AUTO

protocol.description: protocol used by dependent Network tests (End-to-end, Path Trace, PMTUD); defaults to TCP

saved_event.description: indicates 1 for a saved event, 0 for a normal test

ssl_version.description: Reflects the verbose ssl protocol version used by a test

ssl_version_id.description: 0 for auto, 3 for SSLv3, 4 for TLS v1.0, 5 for TLS v1.1, 6 for TLS v1.2

type.description: Type of test

use_ntlm.description: choose 0 to use Basic Authentication, or omit field.Requires username/password to be set

use_public_bgp.description: set to 1 to automatically add all available Public BGP Monitors

user_agent.description: user-agent string to be provided during the test

username.description: username to be used to authenticate with the destination server

verify_certificate.description: set to 0 to ignore certificate errors (defaults to 1)

default.description: to set the rule as a default, set this value to 1.

direction.description: [TO_TARGET, FROM_TARGET, BIDIRECTIONAL]	Direction of the test (affects how results are shown)

include_covered_prefixes.description: set to 1 to include queries for subprefixes detected under this prefix

rounds_violating_required.description: specifies the numerator (X value) of the “X of Y times” condition in an alert rule.  Minimum value is 1, maximum value is 10. Must be less than or equal to roundsViolatingOutOf

alerts_enabled.description: choose 1 to enable alerts, or 0 to disable alerts. Defaults to 1

api_links.description: self links to endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to endpoint for test data

bandwidth_measurements.description: set to 1 to measure bandwidth; defaults to 0. Only applies to Enterprise Agents assigned to the test, and requires that networkMeasurements is set.

bgp_measurements.description: choose 1 to enable bgp measurements, 0 to disable; defaults to 1

content_regex.description: regular Expressions	Verify content using a regular expression. This field does not require escaping

enabled.description: 0 or 1	choose 1 to enable the test, 0 to disable the test

follow_redirects.description: set to 0 to not follow HTTP/301 or HTTP/302 redirect directives. Default is 1

http_interval.description: interval to run http server test on

http_target_time.description: target time for HTTP server completion; specified in milliseconds

http_time_limit.description: target time for HTTP server limits; specified in seconds

http_version.description: 2 for default (prefer HTTP/2), 1 for HTTP/1.1 only

include_headers.description: set to 1 to capture response headers for objects loaded by the test.Default is 1.

interval.description: interval to run test on, in seconds

live_share.description: indicates 1 for a test shared with your account group, 0 for a normal test (does not apply to DNS+ tests)

modified_date.description: Last modified by date; shown in UTC

mtu_measurements.description: set to 1 to measure MTU sizes on network from agents to the target.

network_measurements.description: integer	0 or 1	choose 1 to enable network measurements, 0 to disable; defaults to 1

page_load_target_time.description: target time for Page Load completion; specified in seconds (1 to 30); cannot exceed pageLoadTimeLimit value

page_load_time_limit.description: must be larger than httpTimeLimit; defaults to 10 seconds

password.description: password to be used to authenticate with the destination server

path_trace_mode.description: choose inSession to perform the path trace within a TCP session; defaults to classic

probe_mode.description: probe mode used by End-to-end Network Test; only valid if protocol is set to TCP; defaults to AUTO

protocol.description: protocol used by dependent Network tests (End-to-end, Path Trace, PMTUD); defaults to TCP

saved_event.description: indicates 1 for a saved event, 0 for a normal test

ssl_version.description: Reflects the verbose ssl protocol version used by a test

ssl_version_id.description: 0 for auto, 3 for SSLv3, 4 for TLS v1.0, 5 for TLS v1.1, 6 for TLS v1.2

subinterval.description: subinterval for round-robin testing (in seconds), must be less than or equal to interval

type.description: Type of test

use_ntlm.description: choose 0 to use Basic Authentication, or omit field.Requires username/password to be set

use_public_bgp.description: set to 1 to automatically add all available Public BGP Monitors

user_agent.description: user-agent string to be provided during the test

username.description: username to be used to authenticate with the destination server

verify_certificate.description: set to 0 to ignore certificate errors (defaults to 1)

default.description: to set the rule as a default, set this value to 1.

direction.description: [TO_TARGET, FROM_TARGET, BIDIRECTIONAL]	Direction of the test (affects how results are shown)

include_covered_prefixes.description: set to 1 to include queries for subprefixes detected under this prefix

minimum_sources.description: The minimum number of agents or monitors that must meet the specified criteria in order to trigger an alert

minimum_sources_pct.description: The minimum percentage of agents or monitors that must meet the specified criteria in order to trigger an alert

notify_on_clear.description: set to 1 to trigger the notification when the alert clears.

rounds_violating_mode.description: ANY or EXACT.  EXACT requires that the same agent(s) meet the threshold in consecutive rounds; default is ANY

rounds_violating_out_of.description: specifies the divisor (Y value) of the “X of Y times” condition in an alert rule.  Minimum value is 1, maximum value is 10.

rounds_violating_required.description: specifies the numerator (X value) of the “X of Y times” condition in an alert rule.  Minimum value is 1, maximum value is 10. Must be less than or equal to roundsViolatingOutOf

rule_id.description: If alertsEnabled is set to 1 and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, applicable defaults will be used.

block.description: List of notifications for the Alert Rule
get ruleId from /alert-rules endpoint. If alertsEnabled is set to 1 and alertRules is not included in a creation/update query, applicable defaults will be used.

builtin.description: 1 for built-in labels, and 0 for user-created labels. Note that built-in labels are read-only

type.description: Type of label (tests, agents, endpoint_tests, or endpoint_agents

block.description: array of DNS Server objects {“serverName”: “fqdn of server”}

alerts_enabled.description: choose 1 to enable alerts, or 0 to disable alerts. Defaults to 1

api_links.description: self links to endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to endpoint for test data

bandwidth_measurements.description: set to 1 to measure bandwidth; defaults to 0. Only applies to Enterprise Agents assigned to the test, and requires that networkMeasurements is set.

bgp_measurements.description: choose 1 to enable bgp measurements, 0 to disable; defaults to 1

enabled.description: 0 or 1	choose 1 to enable the test, 0 to disable the test

interval.description: interval to run test on, in seconds

live_share.description: indicates 1 for a test shared with your account group, 0 for a normal test (does not apply to DNS+ tests)

modified_date.description: Last modified by date; shown in UTC

mtu_measurements.description: set to 1 to measure MTU sizes on network from agents to the target.

network_measurements.description: integer	0 or 1	choose 1 to enable network measurements, 0 to disable; defaults to 1

options_regex.description: regex string. This field does not require escaping.

path_trace_mode.description: choose inSession to perform the path trace within a TCP session; defaults to classic

probe_mode.description: probe mode used by End-to-end Network Test; only valid if protocol is set to TCP; defaults to AUTO

register_enabled.description: 1 to perform SIP registration on the test target with the SIP REGISTER command, defaults to 0

saved_event.description: indicates 1 for a saved event, 0 for a normal test

sip_target_time.description: target time for test completion; specified in milliseconds

use_public_bgp.description: set to 1 to automatically add all available Public BGP Monitors

builtin.description: 1 for built-in labels, and 0 for user-created labels. Note that built-in labels are read-only

type.description: Type of label (tests, agents, endpoint_tests, or endpoint_agents

block.description: array of DNS Server objects {“serverName”: “fqdn of server”}

auth_user.description: username for authentication with SIP server

password.description: password to be used to authenticate with the destination server

protocol.description: transport layer for SIP communication: TCP, TLS (TLS over TCP), or UDP. Defaults to TCP

sip_proxy.description: SIP proxy that is distinct from the SIP server, specified as a domain name or IP address

sip_registrar.description: SIP server to be tested, specified by domain name or IP address

user.description: username for SIP registration; should be unique within a ThousandEyes Account Group

alerts_enabled.description: choose 1 to enable alerts, or 0 to disable alerts. Defaults to 1

api_links.description: self links to endpoint to pull test metadata, and data links to endpoint for test data

bgp_measurements.description: choose 1 to enable bgp measurements, 0 to disable; defaults to 1

dscp_id.description: A Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) is a value found in an IP packet header which is used to request a level of priority for delivery (Defined in RFC 2474 https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2474.txt). It is one of the Quality of Service management tools used in router configuration to protect real-time and high priority data applications.

duration.description: duration of test, in seconds (5 to 30)

enabled.description: 0 or 1	choose 1 to enable the test, 0 to disable the test

interval.description: interval to run test on, in seconds

jitter_buffer.description: de-jitter buffer size, in seconds (0 to 150)

live_share.description: indicates 1 for a test shared with your account group, 0 for a normal test (does not apply to DNS+ tests)

modified_date.description: Last modified by date; shown in UTC

mtu_measurements.description: set to 1 to measure MTU sizes on network from agents to the target.

saved_event.description: indicates 1 for a saved event, 0 for a normal test

target_agent_id.description: pull from /agents endpoint	Both the 'agents': [] and the targetAgentID cannot be cloud agents. Can be Enterprise Agent -> Cloud, Cloud -> Enterprise Agent, or Enterprise Agent -> Enterprise Agent

type.description: Type of test

use_public_bgp.description: set to 1 to automatically add all available Public BGP Monitors

default.description: to set the rule as a default, set this value to 1.

direction.description: [TO_TARGET, FROM_TARGET, BIDIRECTIONAL]	Direction of the test (affects how results are shown)

include_covered_prefixes.description: set to 1 to include queries for subprefixes detected under this prefix

minimum_sources_pct.description: The minimum percentage of agents or monitors that must meet the specified criteria in order to trigger an alert

notify_on_clear.description: set to 1 to trigger the notification when the alert clears.

rounds_violating_out_of.description: specifies the divisor (Y value) of the “X of Y times” condition in an alert rule.  Minimum value is 1, maximum value is 10.

rounds_violating_required.description: specifies the numerator (X value) of the “X of Y times” condition in an alert rule.  Minimum value is 1, maximum value is 10. Must be less than or equal to roundsViolatingOutOf

ip_address.description: IP address of the BGP monitor

monitor_name.description: display name of the BGP monitor

monitor_type.description: either Public or Private, shows the type of monitor

network.description: name of the autonomous system in which the monitor is found
